news.title: Berkshire May Have Sold Apple, Bank of America Stock in Third Quarter
news.summary: Berkshire Hathaway  sold $12 billion of stocks in the third quarter, and  Apple  and  Bank of America  lead the list of potential sale candidates.  Berkshire likely will release its quarterly 13-F report late Friday detailing its equity holdings of U.S.-listed securities as of Sept. 30.  Friday is the deadline for 13-F filings, and Berkshire typically waits until the final day to file.

news.title: Apple’s MLS Streaming Shift May Alter Revenue-Share Plans
news.summary: When Apple and MLS announced their 10-year streaming tie-up in 2022, there were two key financial components: a $250 million annual guarantee from Apple, plus the opportunity for MLS to get a share of additional revenue if the new Season Pass subscription product achieved a certain level of success. news.title: Tesla Stock Drops Below $400. Retail Investors Keep Buying.
news.summary: Despite recent declines, shares remain very popular with retail investors.  The selling made Tesla shares one of the worst performers in the  according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Tesla stock hasn’t closed below $400 since mid-September.

news.title: Apple Stock Outperforms Big Tech Peers During Selloff
news.summary: Apple  stock was down slightly on Wednesday, but still performing better than most of its Magnificent Seven peers as Wall Street rotates its investments out of tech names that are spending big on artificial intelligence.  The stock market took a hit on Thursday as investors turned their focus from the government shutdown to concerns that the Federal Reserve wouldn’t be cutting interest rates again in December.  On top of those concerns, there was a continued decline in tech stocks as investors worry about hefty AI spending and high valuations.

news.title: AI-Fueled Apple Partner Engineers New Buy Point. Then This Happens.
news.summary: Partnering with top brands like Apple, Amazon and Tesla, Jabil stock targets a breakout but hits resistance.

news.title: Apple lowers App Store commissions for 'mini apps'
news.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Apple on Thursday said it would lower commissions for "mini apps" on iPhones ​and other devices.  Under the program announced Thursday, that rate will come down to 15% ‌for developers of mini apps - often game titles and other apps that are offered inside a larger "host app" - if they adopt certain Apple technologies such as its method for declaring an age range of the user.  Mini apps are ⁠most common in China, ‌where popular apps like Tencent Holdings and Alipay host scores of game titles or other services inside their primary application.

news.title: How to build a winning portfolio like a pro
news.summary: Worried this AI-fueled rally is a bubble waiting to pop? On Trading Pit, Stocks in Translation host Jared Blikre and Trader Talk host Kenny Polcari break down how pros really manage risk, from matching your timeframe and goals to using the S&P 500 (^GSPC) as a core benchmark. They walk through sector rotations in healthcare and utilities, show why charts flagged Lululemon (LULU) and Palantir (PLTR) as “priced for perfection,” and explain the volatility trade-off in names like IonQ (IONQ) versus broader tech ETFs. You’ll learn how to avoid accidental overexposure to giants like Apple (AAPL), use basic technicals and P/E ratios, and keep emotions in check as you build a portfolio that can survive the next round of market turbulence. For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.
